result.execSummary:
The defendant Scott F Lilienkamp was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Court costs are to be paid as a Condition of Probation.

  If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling.
AODA assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended.

ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
Submit to random urine screens.
No use or possession of alcohol, illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.
No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of any and all prescriptions.
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.
No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged and distributed.
Anger Management and Domestic Violence Treatment and follow through as deemed appropriate by Agent.
No contact with the victim listed in the Criminal Complaint.

records.addlTxt: Received and filed in court by the State.
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Brian J. Juech appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Scott F Lilienkamp in court with attorney Daniel P Fay.  
Jury Trial Canceled.

Defendant enters a plea    to count 3.
Court finds the defendant Guilty of counts.
DV enhancer is struck on count 3.
Counts 1, 2 & 4 are dismissed as read ins.

State is requesting $2,349.65 in restitution on behalf of the victim.
Defense objects and presented arguments.
Court Denies - Request for Restitution.
No statutory authority.
Reasons placed on the record.


Court orders the following:
150 Days in the Waukesha County Jail w/huber (all standard release conditions).
STAYED

Term of Probation:  1 Year.
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:  
Anger Management or DV Treatment and follow through as deemed appropriate by agent.
AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
No Use or Possession of a controlled substances or drug paraphernalia.
No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of all prescriptions
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling 
No contact with:  victim listed in the criminal complaint.
No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged, or distributed.

Costs:  $243
To be paid as a Condition of Probation.
